Name: powdery
Symptoms: White or gray powdery spots on the surface of leaves, stems, and flowers.
Infected leaves may become distorted, yellow, or wilted.
Plants may experience stunted growth or reduced yield.
Treatments: Remove and destroy infected leaves to prevent further spread.
Avoid overhead watering to keep the leaves dry.
Provide adequate spacing between plants to improve air circulation.
Rotate crops to reduce pathogen buildup in the soil.

Name: rust
Symptoms: White or gray powdery spots on the surface of leaves, stems, and flowers.
Infected leaves may become distorted, yellow, or wilted.
Plants may experience stunted growth or reduced yield.
Treatments: Remove and destroy infected plant parts.
Water plants early in the morning and avoid wetting the foliage.
Ensure plants are placed in well-ventilated areas with proper spacing.
